dct_title_s: KAART der REYZE van drie Schepen naar het ZUYDLAND in de Jaaren 1721 en 1722
dct_description_sm: JKS NOTE: Two maps are on this record: one in black and white, one in color.
Possibly the work of Isaac Tirion.

Shows the voyage of three Dutch ships under the command of Capt. Jacob Roggeveen from Amsterdam to Iava. Includes partial outlines of N. Zeeland, van Diemens Land, Nieuw Holland, and t'Land van Quiri.

California as an island with indented coastline and place names including K. Blanco, K.S. Sebastiaan, and F. Draks baai. (No previous use of 'K' used for 'cape' seen.) Water passage continues north between Compagnies Land and Noord America.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
